author: timbeiko
content: One thing worth mentioning is that 1559 will likely go live around the same time as the difficulty bomb starts to get noticed (next sprint/early summer). I think this changes the calculus re: miners. I'm also personally much more in favor of raising the block reward to compensate them vs. burning less fees, because it makes the protocol easier to reason about, especially when we don't even know what % of fees will be burnt given a large share of on-chain usage is for DeFi arbitrage and may still pay a big tip post-1559.

author: sky.cactus
content: By definition, miner costs scale almost exactly as much as we need them to scale.  The Ethereum network (users via fees and holders via supply inflation) pay a certain amount for security, and miners will increasing hashing power if the network pays more and miners will decrease hashing power if the network pays less.  Miners giving us an itemized bill won't change anything, and I'm loath to ask them to put such a thing together (a potentially time consuming task) only to have us essentially ignore it because it.
